title: Leonardo Bonucci dropped for Juventus’ Champions League clash following bust-up with boss Max Allegri
text:
5 Leonardo Bonucci clashed with Max Allegri in Juventus’ 4-1 win over Palermo 
He was later fined by the club for his actions which also including sprinting straight down the tunnel in Juventus’ 4-1 victory 
Keep up to date with ALL the Juventus news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
And his punishment won’t end there after Allegri admitted he will leave the 29-year-old out of the squad for the all-important clash. 
He said: “Leonardo Bonucci will not be in the squad tomorrow; it is right to do so on behalf of the club, fans and team. 
“As an important and intelligent Juventus player, Bonucci understands the decision.” Getty Images Juventus trained without Leonardo Bonucci ahead of their Champions League tie Getty Images Gonzalo Higuain is likely to lead the line against the Portuguese side related articles EURO CLASH LIVE - Man City 1 Monaco 0: Raheem Sterling fires City off to perfect start in last 16 tie while Atletico lead Leverkusen In for the Kyl Everything you need to know about Monaco's Kylian Mbappe... who is dubbed the 'next Thierry Henry' Preview What time does Bayer Leverkusen vs Atletico Madrid in the Champions League kick off and what TV channel is it on?
